intro: Cyrtandra wainihaensis, commonly known as the Wainiha Enigma, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
